title: Understanding ARFID
text: $$\frac{Avoidant}{Restrictive}$$ Food Intake Disorder (ARFID) is a relatively new diagnosis in the realm of eating disorders. It is important to distinguish it from other eating disorders like anorexia or bulimia.

title: Characteristics of ARFID
text: ARFID is characterized by a persistent failure to meet appropriate nutritional and/or energy needs. This can lead to significant weight loss, nutritional deficiency, dependence on enteral feeding or oral nutritional supplements, and marked interference with psychosocial functioning.

hintAnswer: a newer eating disordercharacterized as a disturbance with eating or feeding where nutritional or energy needs are continuously not met
title: Identifying ARFID
text: Which of the following best describes ARFID?
choices: there is a reduction in essential nutrients needed to maintain adequate bodily functions
a newer eating disordercharacterized as a disturbance with eating or feeding where nutritional or energy needs are continuously not met
starting of oral intake for clients with anorexia
